word:
Ellen White Reflects on 
                  James White's Death 


     After my husband died, one of our brethren, who thought a great deal of him, said, "Do not let them bury him, but pray to the Lord that He may bring him to life again."  I said, "No, no, although I realize my great loss, I will not do this,"  I felt that he had done his work.  No one but myself knew how great a load he had carried in the efforts we had put forth to advance the truth.  He had done the work of three men.
